intro: Sirmuellera, commonly known as the silverleaf sirmuellera, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plants are characterized by their silver-gray leaves, which are covered in fine, dense hairs. Sirmuellera species typically grow as shrubs or small trees, often found in humid, lowland forests. They produce small, showy flowers that are usually pink or white, attracting various pollinators.
